IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To increase sustainable homeownership, financial literacy education, and economic opportunity for the active-military and veteran communities.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To increase sustainable homeownership, financial literacy education, and economic opportunity for the active-military and veteran communities.
IRS990.Desc: The organization rehabilitated 76 homes and sold at a discounted purchase price to active duty military and veterans. In addition, the organization paid the escrow fees and other expenses during the rehabilitation period.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Provided information to veterans and active duty military about home ownership opportunities and the VA loan program. Provided financial and homeownership mentoring and counseling to veterans. Provided information and education to real estate professionals about VA loans and home ownership opportunities.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Planned and sponsored a policy conference in Washington, D.C and a national conference in Phoenix, AZ. Through the conferences educational information, awareness and training was provided to real estate professionals, active military and veterans about the resources available to facilitate home ownership, including the VA home loan program.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: Residences for veterans to own and

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Donation to Act. Miltary and Vets

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization provides mortgage free or discounted residential properties to active military, veteran, or surviving spouse. Applicants are required to show proof of military service and proof of income. Applicants are awarded assistance on the basis of need and availability of properties. Upon awarding homes, we provide financial education and housing counseling to ensure home recipients understand the responsibility of homeownership but also set up a budget and are able to keep and maintain the home.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Provided information to veterans and active duty military about home ownership opportunities and the VA loan program. Provided financial and homeownership mentoring and counseling to veterans. Provided information and education to real estate professionals about VA loans and home ownership opportunities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is presented to the Board of Directors for review prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Information is available upon request.
